House Bill/Resolution NO. PS00059
FULL TITLE : NEED FOR AN EFFICIENT SYSTEM TO IMPLEMENT THE PROTECTIVE SERVICES PROGRAM (PSP) OF THE DSWD
SHORT TITLE : Commission On Audit / Department Of Social Welfare And Development Circular
ABSTRACT : ... Rep. Gabriel H. Bordado Jr...spoke about MC No. 9 issued by the DSWD Secretary, entitled, “Supplemental Guidelines on the Implementation of the Protective Services Program (PSP),” in relation to the Supreme Court decision declaring the unconstitutionality of the Priority Development Assistance Fund (PDAF). He said that the DSWD Circular underscores, among others, that “referral letters from individuals, group of individuals or organizations including public officials ... are not integral to the implementation of the PSP and that the DSWD retains the sole authority to determine the beneficiaries of the program pursuant to existing guidelines.”...; pointed out that there should be an effective and efficient system to ensure that qualified beneficiaries will have proper access to the program, and that an intensive information dissemination campaign is set up...; reminded the DSWD Secretary of President Duterte’s vow to end the long queues for those who wish to avail themselves of government services.(SOURCE: House Journal No.17,p.22)
PRINCIPAL AUTHOR/S : BORDADO, GABRIEL H.
